extension.name: Content - GCalendar Next Event
extension.author: G4J Project
extension.copyright: This extension is released under the GNU/GPL License.
extension.description:
Embeds a date from a Google Calendar event into content.

Example Usage: {gcalnext [$title$] starts on [$start$] and ends at [$finish %I:%M%P]$} would print "My event starts on Novemeber 3, 2009 @ 2:30pm and ends at 3:30pm"

Keywords are surrounded by [$ and $]. Anything not contained within a keyword marker is taken literally. Use the following keywords. All formatting is in strftime format.

  • startdate fmt-- print the starting date of the event in fmt format.
  • finishdate fmt -- print the finishing date of the event in fmt format.
  • range -- displays a compact range for start and finish (e.g. Nov 2, 1970 2:30pm - 3:30pm or Nov 2-5, 1970)
  • title -- Title of the event
  • description -- Description from the event's description
  • backlink -- url to the GCalendar entry (internal link)
  • link -- url to the Google Calendar entry (external link)
  • maplink -- anchor containing the location and a link to Google Maps for the location
  • maphref -- just the url to the Google Maps
  • location -- text location from the event
  • where -- same as location
  • calendarname -- name of the calendar
  • calendarcolor -- hex representation of the calendar's assigned color

Parameters affecting the operation of the plugin are also allowed. They are specified just like keywords, except they start with a plus (+) sign. Any of the parameters you can specify here as defaults are also parameters that may be specified in the plugin. Check each parameter for the name to use.

Example: {gcalnext [$+calendarid 2|1|4|6$][$+event_filter .*Birthday.*$][$title$] is on [$start date %B, %D, %Y$]} might print Erics Birthday is on Nov 05, 2009.

Example: {gcalnext [$+calendarid 2$][$+event_filter .*Birthday.*$][$+output [\$title$\] is on [\$start date %B, %D, %Y$\] $]} would produce the same output. Note the escaped parameters in output.

fields.name: params
fields.fieldset:
>
[$ startdate $] at [$ maplink $]
Here you can modify the default event output. Use strftime formatting for dates. Valid functions are embedded in [$ cmd args ... $], everything outside of that is taken literally. Valid functions are: start, finish, location (text location), maphref (url to google maps), maplink (anchor link to google maps with the location embedded as the link) and title.
[$ title %] is happening right now here: [$ maplink $]
[$ title $] is starting soon.
[$ title $] is coming to an end.
No scheduled events could be found.

field.name: offset
field.label: Event Order Offset
field.description: Show the event X number of events after the immediate next event. (plugin: +offset)

field.name: find
field.label: Event Search
field.description: Find events whose text/description match. Use standard Google query tricks ("exact search", "-not_this_word", this that other) (plugin: +find)

field.name: title_filter
field.label: Event Title Filter
field.description: Show only events with titles that match this regular expression. (plugin: +title_filter)

field.name: start_date
field.label: Start Date
field.description: Limit to events that have only started since this date (can be relative) (plugin: +start_date)

field.name: end_date
field.label: End Date
field.description: Limit to events that will start before date (can be relative) (plugin: +end_date)

field.name: max_events
field.label: Max Events
field.description: Download only the next specified number of events to choose the next one. (plugin: +max_events)

field.name: dateformat
field.label: Default date format
field.description: Use this strftime format as the default way to display a date (plugin: +dateformat)

field.name: only-whole_day
field.description: Default date range format for a single all day event (strftime format). (plugin: +only-whole_day)
field.label: Rangle Format (single all day)

field.name: only-part_day
field.description: Default date range format for a single day event (strftime format) (plugin: +only-part_day)
field.label: Rangle Format (single day)

field.name: multi-whole_day
field.description: Default date range format for a multiple day all day event (strftime format) (plugin: +multi-whole_day)
field.label: Rangle Format (multiple all day)

field.name: multi-part_day
field.description: Default date range format for a single day event (strftime format) (plugin: +multi-part_day)
field.label: Rangle Format (multi day)

field.name: gc_cache_time
field.label: Cache Time
field.description: The time before the plugin is recached in sec.
